website_summaries.verdict: It works reliably, though there are occasional reports of failure after a few months of use.
pros: USB ports charge devices fast with 1.8-amp output each
Responsive customer service can assist with install problems
cons: Some reports of USB ports failing after a few months
Electrical box is larger than standard outlet electrical boxes

customer_reviews.title: Quit in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for 9 months then one of the USB ports quit working, then this month, one month after the first USB quit working, the other side quit and it will no longer charge anything. Ive plugged several devices in with cords that work fine with other chargers and this receptacle will not charge anything. Its too bad because this is a very handy device.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Works with iPhone 6 Plus.
customer_reviews.text: Charges my iPhone 6 Plus – seems faster than the charger it came with, which is consistent with the reports that Apple ships a 1A charger with the iPhones and this charger outputs 3.6A. The outlet does protrude beyond the faceplate about 1/8" but it doesn't bother me. The outlet that I replaced had 5 wires attached, 2 black, 2 white, and a ground (bare). On first glance it looked like this Leviton only had three screws (white, black, and ground), so for a couple minutes I was confused on how to wire this, but after reading up and looking at the wiring diagram, I saw that the white and black screw clamps on this Leviton accept two wires each.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Suzuki

customer_reviews.title: 20 year Electrician "I would not instal in a single gang"
customer_reviews.text: So I got this thing to put in for the wife, it has vented sides to let heat get off the tiny xformer and rectifeir in it but the device so big it seemed sketchy to install in the single gang cut in box I had installed in the wall.. there is a cubic inch warning in the fine print of included CYOA docs, I want to say 23 ci but may be wrong
customer_reviews.author: JACOB GOOD

customer_reviews.title: Prone to breaking.
customer_reviews.text: All USB outlets have a tab that keeps you from plugging a cable in backwards. It also provides some rigidity to the contacts. This outlet has sort of week tabs that tend to break easily. I installed two of these for four USB outlets total, and two of the four are broken in less than a year. I am now considering replacing these with normal outlets and going back to the wall warts. These do a good job charging, even IPADs, which draw a lot of USB current. When you put a largish plug into the bottom AC outlet, you may not be able to also plug in a USB cable.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Broke with minimal usage
customer_reviews.text: Only been installed for 2 months, and it's broken and non-functional. It just stopped charging the other day. When I removed my USB cord, I noticed the part of the outlet broke off inside my cable. The same two charging cables have been plugged in for the whole time it's been installed, so I have to credit either a faulty product or a manufacturing defect. I was really surprised to have a problem with this outlet. I have an older model (one plug/one low power USB/one high power USB) that has been trouble free for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bear

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 6 months and now the USB plug no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: EdgewayDrive

customer_reviews.title: Another great idea that isn't quite ready for prime-time
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE! While it does meet all it's specifications, I can't emphasize how big it is. It's almost twice as deep as a normal outlet and then *also* sticks out through the front of the cover plate about 1/4". While it has two grounded outlets and 2 USB outlets, if you have USB cords plugged in, they block one or both of the 110V outlets, depending on the size of the plug you're trying to plug in. Had I known all this, I wouldn't have bothered.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Great while it works, very poor Leviton customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this outlet and a few weeks later the usb ports stopped working. I contacted Leviton and their customer service asked me to send it to them at MY EXPENSE so they can figure out what went wrong with their product. No way am I spending $$ to return this defective product. This is great while it works, but don't expect any reasonable customer service from Leviton after the sale.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Liked it enough I purchased this replacement
customer_reviews.text: My original unit died after a power surge from a recent electrical storm. This unit was the same to install, very tight in the box, but had some pluses and minuses. Plus: The new unit charges faster than my old unit - the higher amperage connector works with the fast charge on my S-series phones. so that's good. Minus: Tamper. Resistant. Outlets. The less said about these, the better... Since I bought it mostly for the USB charging, I'll live. I can always use a different outlet to plug in 120V items.
customer_reviews.author: E.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product...At first
customer_reviews.text: This was my husbands favorite gift. There is no 'humming' noise. **UPDATE** after my sons iPhone froze and subsequently died, it did not occur to me that this outlet was the reason why until my phone did the same. I just happened to be reading some other reviews where other users were having the same issue, and a lightbulb went off in my mind. Now I have no idea how to get an outlet that will not ruin my devices so I guess I'm going back to the cube :(
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Replaced it with another at no charge to the customer but just one call back is to many in less than a three month time frame and I will lose more money if others go bad with in a year
customer_reviews.text: I am an electrician and bought an 8-pack of these and installed a few in the last couple months and had a call back today for one not working and it was the receptacles that were not working. Replaced it with another at no charge to the customer but just one call back is to many in less than a three month time frame and I will lose more money if others go bad with in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Rich T.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 7 months
customer_reviews.text: This outlet worked well for 7 months, then it began emitting a very high pitched whine. It has been used to charge iPhones (6s and X) and to constantly power an Amazon echo dot. It is mounted behind our microwave away from moisture. The USB ports haven’t quit yet, but the whine is loud enough to be extremely obnoxious. I had to uninstall it the day it went bad! I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: What a pain in the rear.
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to have these by our night stands. I paid an electrician to install and within four months both of them stopped working. Now I have to pay him again to replace. Plus, while I wait, I am limited with what I am able to plug into the outlet since I cannot use a six outlet adapter and don't have any of the other kinds.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Now just really expensive outlets.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of this hoping to eliminate the charging blocks that we always seem to be in need of. Within 7 months one side of the one I use went bad and now both sides of the one my wife uses quit. I still have one side left but not anticipating it to last much longer. I read the reviews and weighed the pros and cons thinking/hoping that I’d get two outlets that last. NOPE! I would save the money and get a USB strip to charge multiple items from and leave the outlets alone.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: It's big...
customer_reviews.text: I tried for about a half hour to install this tonight without any luck. The one thing I didn't consider is how much deeper this is than regular plugs. Unfortunately the outlet I chose to install it in has 3 lines connecting to it and as home wiring is not terribly flexible, I could not get this thing shoved into the box far enough to secure it (and mostly without forcing one of the wires loose). If you have only one wire it's probably no big deal. 2 might work if your box is roomier. I have a tight box and 3 sets of wires and it just seems like a lost cause...
customer_reviews.author: Chad Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, but Enormous
customer_reviews.text: Great Leviton Quality, does fast charging well, and the arrangement of the USB plugs makes it so you can use all four positions at the same time. But boy-howdy these things are huge. Never could get one of them to fit in a compact single gang box. If you want to use them, be sure you've got room to spare in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Williams

customer_reviews.title: Save the use of your electrical outlets while charging two devices. - BUT:
customer_reviews.text: This plug allows full use of the electrical plug that is over the kitchen counter while allowing family to charge two devices Update 9/17/18 - After 9 months the USB plugs are still working fine to charge various items, but the lower 125V plug has failed to make contact with any appliance that is plugged into it. I will probably change it out to another Leviton receptacle as I believe that Leviton does furnish the highest quality fittings overll.
customer_reviews.author: Philipp2

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Useful Product
customer_reviews.text: Buying this Leviton Charger/Receptacle was probably one of the most intelligent things I've done in years. It's made life so much easier to have two kinds of cables available within reaching distance when I need them. No more taking over the receptacle with plug-in chargers or having wires all over my desk with a hub. So far this receptacle has done yoman service not just as a charger but also as the plug for my lamp and my printer. I was so impressed that I got one for my son-in-law for his birthday. He's happy with his, too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Burr

customer_reviews.title: Body of unit is very wide - doesn't fit in all wall boxes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these outlets to replace older outlets in key locations. But I found that they are too wide for the single wall boxes I was installing into. The plastic back part (the dark part surrounding the visible front in the product photo), was very wide and bulky. I was able to sneak one of these into a five-gang box just fine, but the other one is going back in favor of something with a narrower body.
customer_reviews.author: MonicaB

customer_reviews.title: Great way to clean up those USB charging cords!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I was getting tired of running an extension cord to my end table to plug in my lamp, plus charging cables for my tablet and phone. Decided to update my end table with modern conveniences by installing this outlet. I mounted it inside a regular outlet box from the hardware store after cutting out a whole in the side. What a difference! Now the cords are nicely contained with only a decorative extension cord running from behind the end table to the outlet. No more cords all over the floor!
customer_reviews.author: 3kidsinaustin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. Very happy with purchase. Buy faceplate locally if possible.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I made the mistake of buying the first one in ivory color when the rest of the room was light almond. Easy to miss! I bought this one because of the higher charging amperage and the smart chip and it has charged everything admirably so far. Pool vacuum iPhones iPads earbuds amazon fire. If you have the ability to buy the faceplate locally you’ll save quite a bit because they are only about 50 cents at Home Depot but the cheapest faceplates I could find on amazon were several dollars. Very easy to install. Turned off breaker, attached wires and had everything done in 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Having the second outlet is much better though I understand why as it's a much more ...
customer_reviews.text: I had the earlier version of this plug that only had 1 electrical outlet. Having the second outlet is much better though I understand why as it's a much more crowded layout if you have the 2 plugs and 2 USB filled up. The only downside is that the size of the unit itself is quite large to you will need to ensure that you are using a larger gang box to house it. It also comes forward almost 1/4" from the face plate. I thought the electricians didn't have enough room and it jutted out but that's not the case so beware if you were hoping that the plug would be flush with the decora plate.
customer_reviews.author: lithiumus

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't serve the purpose
customer_reviews.text: I needed to be able to plug an Oral-B toothbrush and hair dryer into the regular outlets and a USB cable into the USB port. As you can see from the photo, the hairdryer plug partially blocks the USB outlet, making this useless. This outlet works only if the regular AC plugs are small, like the toothbrush plug shown in the top outlet in my photo. This outlet also sticks out a bit from the wall plate so it doesn't have the nice flat look that Decora style outlets should have.
customer_reviews.author: Frog Man

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: USB charging port works fine. But the construction of the item would not allow plugs to be inserted. Something internal not aligned correctly. Removed from service. I will not use an outlet unless it's perfect. Too many things can go seriously wrong when electricity is involved.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen J.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure?
customer_reviews.text: The unit works perfectly now, but when I installed it, only the AC outlets were working. I scratched my head and moved onto another project, leaving this installed for about a week. Out of the blue, I plugged my phone into the USB jack on this thing and: EUREKA. Not sure why the USB ports didn't work on this, and no idea how long it actually took them to "come on", but they have worked ever since. Even came back on after a power outage and a couple of brown outs. I give it 4 stars since I can't explain why the USB ports didn't come on immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Steph Leppard

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn't appear to work
customer_reviews.text: Electrical engineer here with wiring experience. Installed, troubleshot with multiple different USB cables and devices. The 5V USB output is intermittent at best. Time to put back my old outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Jag304

customer_reviews.title: Levitron Does it Again
customer_reviews.text: Well know for absolute the best quality electrical devices in the biz, has done it again. This is a very useful device for phone, tablets, and laptops. Charge without having to find the nasty little wall plug in. Just plug usb into the wall. This device mounted in minutes with great electrical quality that it made the job easy and professional. Kudos for Levitron
customer_reviews.author: Doug Felsenthal

customer_reviews.title: works advertised, quite large, sometimes buzzes with AC loads
customer_reviews.text: Expect to do some wiring gymnastics to get this device into a standard size box. This style outlet is always on the large size so this one isn't unique. Once installed, it works as expected. I did notice that when I plug my laptop into it, it has a high pitch buzz or which intermittently -- not sure if that's my laptop or a fault in the unit but it doesn't bother me and charges phones without an issue which is the primary need.
customer_reviews.author: Asthmatic Smokey the Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great way to ad versatility to your outlets!
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that these will use all of the space you have in the electrical box and that the wires are inserted into the back on one side. I have one receptacle that wouldn't fit because the backsplash will tile overhangs the electric box so if you have any clearance issues like that these will not work for you. Having said that these are fantastic and a great way to ad versatility to your outlets and get rid of the unsightly USB transformers needed in a "regular" outlet. I've added these in the kitchen and under our bar for us and guests to have ready access to power their devices.
customer_reviews.author: RWB

customer_reviews.title: Simple to Install!
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant evolution in charging ports. Finally you can ignore so many of those bulky 120V to USB adapters that come with, well, Everything that needs to be charged these days! Just get a couple of these for your outlets where cell phones and devices gather and get those "USB Boxes" off the wall and get your outlets back for more important things!
customer_reviews.author: BHarris

customer_reviews.title: Faulty. Randomly started tripping circuit after just 11 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and installed it w/o issue. It worked great for 11 months but yesterday it started to trip my circuit breaker. I wasn't even using it. I almost called an electrician and spent $200-$500 but after some troubleshooting, I replaced this piece of crap with my old regular outlet and the breaker started working again. This is the second Leviton product that has suddenly and randomly stopped working. I'm never buying another Leviton product again!
customer_reviews.author: Faraz

customer_reviews.title: It's HUGE inside the wall
customer_reviews.text: The outlet consumes a lot of space inside of the electrical box. It does not fit in a 2.5", cut-corner, gem box. I had to install a Wiremold surface extension to get the outlet to seat flush. A 3.5", plastic, nail-on should be just fine unless you've got red wirenuts behind it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Soli

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory
customer_reviews.text: this allows you to charge two devices at the same time. I used two iPhones a 5 &6. I wonder if it would have enough current to charge a tablet and an iPhone 6? 3.1 amps should be plenty. Single device charging: I think this USB charger outputs 3.1 amps in either port since my phone went from 20% charge to 100 % in about half hour. Fast charging is not recommended as it causes damage on your battery. I usually charge both iPhones at the same time anyway. So I have no problem with that. Plus when visitors come, they always come with their dead phones so they always need a quick charge. This will Be perfect for them.
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex

customer_reviews.title: I've shared the word on this product with friends and neigbors - smart chip to prevent over charging is a very very ...
customer_reviews.text: One suggestion since the customer is purchasing online rather than at a home do it store. why not include a cover for this particular outlet, they don't cost that much yet requires a trip to a store for the cover. I've shared the word on this product with friends and neigbors - smart chip to prevent over charging is a very very good deal , my true rating is 4 3/4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but be advised that it won't fit in all boxes
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a great way to reduce clutter, but I quickly ran into a problem that doesn't seem to be mentioned here: This will not fit in EVERY type of box. Specifically, if you have a smaller 3x2 "switch" box (see picture), it won't fit. Well, technically it will, BUT the terminals are basically about a millimeter away from the side of the box -- and since the box is metal, that's just not a good idea. It may not make contact, but it also MIGHT. Don't risk it! As long as you have a box that will accommodate it though, it ought to be a sweet way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Videojanitor

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My previous USB duplex receptacle had a 1A and 2A outlet, so never sure if I wasn't overcharging or not charging as high as device could take. This one has two identical outlets and the receptacle determines, based on what you plug in, what the optimal charging power should be. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Chip K

customer_reviews.title: Great charger with plugs
customer_reviews.text: I love this because it allows the usb for charging but has other outlets so you can plug in other devices. I have it in the kitchen so I can charge the phone and use appliances. That being said.... I am able to review this because I bought another at a big box store because I was accidentally sent the wrong item on here.
customer_reviews.author: schlemm

customer_reviews.title: Get back your outlets -- and double your ports, too!
customer_reviews.text: When I realized three outlets in my kitchen needed replacing (e.g., two had broken prongs, one had been carelessly painted over, and another was the wrong color), I wondered: "Why didn't I notice this before now?" Well, because my family members used them to charge their devices, covering up the imperfections (and use of the outlets, I should add!) with their oversized plug-to-USB adapters. It took two savvy searches and a few clicks to order three of these. We now have use of all six outlets and added six USBs, too -- no adapters needed. They are attractive, modern and useful. And when we have company, everyone can plug in. Five stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry S. Kappel

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful and Attractive Outlet
customer_reviews.text: I saw this outlet and realized that it would clean up the power outlet at our kitchen island currently with chargers sticking out. It did, was easy to install and has charged various phones, tablets, etc. nicely. Told friends rebuilding a house in NOLA about this outlet and they had their electrician put them throughout their house based on our experience...wow!
customer_reviews.author: Rlceiss

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not without compromises
customer_reviews.text: It's well built and feels solid. Once installed, it functioned as expected, but beware of a couple of issues: 1) It's deep. It would not fit flush with the solid electrical wires behind it, so I wound up getting a deeper electrical box. Not everyone can easily do this. 2) The lower outlet will not accept a wall wart or anything but the thinest plugs, if the USB ports are in use. I was able to plug in a Google Home wall wart by using a 3-2 prong adapter. Otherwise, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belanger

customer_reviews.title: I like this
customer_reviews.text: Although I like this plug, when I use electric outlet part of it, I have difficulty plugging in. It's not problem with the USB, but I find the non-usb I really have to push hard to get the plug in. Besides that, I love having a usb port connected at the wall outlet-it's very nice!
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Smart sensor works. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Have iPhone 6 iPhone 7 and iPad. It Charges all fine. Can charge three at once with the Apple adapter in one of the receptacles. I tested the charge speed against the original charging equipment and it seemed to be exactly the same. If it does what it claims- and it does for us, then it's worth the extra bucks. It claims to sense the equipment being charged and provide the correct safe voltage. I am not Not an engineer or electrician but it seems to do exactly that. Bottom line? Working well. A +.
customer_reviews.author: smithcover

customer_reviews.title: Not Leviton
customer_reviews.text: I installed these in a commercial location only to have the building inspector force us to remove. Why? No model # stamped on the item: in short, not a real Leviton but a cheap knock off. All UL approved receptacles will be marked as such. This is not. Beware. No UL or other approval.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: UL Certified?
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Had to work to get it into existing box and to get face plate flush. One feedback says that because it is a Leviton it is UL certified. But I cannot find any indication on the web, on the outlet, on the box, or in the paper work that this outlet is UL certified. Hopefully it won't burn my house down.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K. James

customer_reviews.title: This should be the standard of receptacles
customer_reviews.text: Nowadays this is a no brainer, a must. This should be the standard of wall receptacles, until we will be fully wireless in the future. Can’t go wrong with Leviton.
customer_reviews.author: KRC

customer_reviews.title: Great charger, poor outlet!
customer_reviews.text: The charging circuit works like a champ but as an AC outlet, its grip is kinda wimpy. Maybe the tamper proofing is to blame, but when I tried to plug in a regular line cord, the fit was sloppy and the contact intermittent. Too bad, because the concept is good and the intelligent charging is a real boon. Normally, I would expect better contacts from a brand new Leviton outlet. After all, it IS rated at 15 Amps! So, the charger gets 5 stars but the rest of it looks like 1 star, $0.29 hardware. Still, if you don't plan to use it for anything but charging your USB devices, it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: B. E. Sharrow

customer_reviews.title: Great for kitchens or bathroom
customer_reviews.text: These are great and easy to install for bathrooms and kitchens (as long as the line is connected to another gfci). Allows you to plug in any two USB devices in addition to two regular outlets. Works out great for phone chargers, or backup battery chargers, or even during the holidays, I plugged in some cute USB lit snowmen.
customer_reviews.author: C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on February 27, 2010 and it works really good, until it doesn't. It did a good job and I had no complaints until about 3 weeks ago (July 28, 2020 approx). It just quit charging my devices using the USB slots. The receptacle works fine with electrical plugs just no USB.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Space saving, clean lines
customer_reviews.text: This particular unit fits a standard outlet box, no need for a larger one. The only downside is that when my Kindle is charging, I get a message that says I'm connected to a "low level charger", so maybe it takes longer to reach a full charge. I charge both my Kindle and IPhone overnight, and they're both fully charged in the morning, so maybe it's just a Kindle thing. Works great, and I'm buying more.
customer_reviews.author: SUZICOOKS

customer_reviews.title: pretty good wall outlet
customer_reviews.text: A little bigger than other ones I have bought in the past. I am not sure if that is because I bought cheaper ones in the past or because this is a name brand. It filed the box enough that I thought about getting a larger box for install. the only issue I have with it is the child protection tolerance is really tight. It takes a fair amount of pressure to plug anything in to the plug or usb.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoenigman

customer_reviews.title: Fit & Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I needed an outlet with usb connections in my kitchen area. This replaced the current outlet easily. I can plug two items in the outlet and have two cords connected to the usb outlets at the same time. It is a little tight in the outlet box with very little room for the wires.
customer_reviews.author: kcallahan47

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to a common problem
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, charges quickly and supports rapid charging. Most importantly, it's UL certified! Don't waste your money and put yourself and/or your family at risk by buying a cheaper one that's not UL certified. Leviton is a trusted name. Forget the other cheap Chinese junk that'll burn your house down.
customer_reviews.author: K D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome outlet upgrade
customer_reviews.text: In a world where nearly everything is charged by a USB cord, this is a must have. Outlet is a little bulkier than a standard outlet, so it's a little tighter squeeze in the outlet box. Does a great job of charging iOS devices w/ the cord plugged into the USB port on the outlet. This outlet accepts the Leviton Decora screw-less wall plates, I recommend you check those out. We used a plain black Decora wall plate with this outlet, and it looks much cleaner than the traditional wall plates with screws.
customer_reviews.author: CarsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, went into the existing outlet without an issue. This device can charge my phones / and other devices very quick with the 3.6A (High output in other words, better than some chargers the devices come with! I can be using all outlets and there is no interference. I have 3 similar devices in my house and I really like the flexibility it offers, eventually will have one in every room! You have your 'normal' outlet, plus it allows me to charge two USB devices. With many newer devices no longer using batteries, but require USB to charge, this is a practical item every house hold needs.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Need power management
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had management system . If you have an cable plugged in one port and not charging anything just laying itself. The other port will still only provide 15w no 30w To do so 30w you have to remove the cable that’s not in use.
customer_reviews.author: sahil

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Outlet works, USB charging works! I have Nexus 6p and, when I charge, it doesn't say "Slow charging", but neither it says "Fast charging". So i guess it's somewhere in the middle. Anywho, it takes about 1.5 hr to fully charge the phone and I am happy with that. The unit is quite big in the back, so, if you have old apartments, you will have hard times fitting it inside the wall (I pretty much hammered mine into the old electric box).
customer_reviews.author: Olexii

customer_reviews.title: USB ports both stopped working after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for 6 months but now neither USB ports work only the regular 3 prong plug in's work.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Conrad

customer_reviews.title: USB Dead in a Month
customer_reviews.text: Purchased through amazon on June 6th, worked great in the beginning, 1 month after installation, both USB ports dead, tried different cords, removed outlet looking for something obvious. Just dead!! Not a great value when they last such a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than others but still has flaws.
customer_reviews.text: It’s better than one I bought at Costco because it holds the plug better but it’s still hard sometimes to insert a plug. On the USB side it’s sometimes marginal. This morning my iPhone refused to take power from it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel W. Lewison

customer_reviews.title: Works well, looks good.
customer_reviews.text: I've been consistently using 2 of these for the past 6 months. They felt like a quality product when I installed them and have held up well. They grip onto the USB plugs and power cords very well. This unit costs a bit more then other brands but I would rather go with something a bit more known then some off brand at a cheaper price and risk anything to my house or devices. I have freed up some wall space with this USB outlet, it matches well with my other outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Crash

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trickle charging
customer_reviews.text: 2 outlets and 2 USBs...cant go wrong. No issues with charging apple and samsung products. Be advised this will not 'quick charge' like an external power adapter made by samsung. That is a different technology but thats not an issue (great for guests in the kitchen). Straight forward install - one black (top), one white neutral wire (bottom), and a ground. Just keep in mind where you are placing it because of this.
customer_reviews.author: enzo

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have used standard Leviton outlets and wanted to stay with them for these. straight forward installation and so far, 1 month, no issues. My wife has charged both her Android phone and tablet at the same time without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A.

customer_reviews.title: No screws for double ganging.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product: well engineered, structurally and electrically sound. Minor inconvenience was the absence of second screws or terminal type to allow a double or triple gang assembly: required stripping of wires 6" in, and then at the end. Tedious, but do-able, if you know how to strip wires in-line without damaging the conductors.
customer_reviews.author: Atticus

customer_reviews.title: Added to my 'essential in every apartment' list - should be on yours too!
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I'm going to do from now on when moving apartments, is get one of these and replace the bedside outlet. It's a simple change (if you haven't learned how to change an outlet, you should - turn off the breaker, unscrew the old cover and outlet, swap the 2 or 3 wires from the old unit to the new one, put back together, turn the breaker back on) that makes a huge difference. I went from having a power splitter with 2 wall warts (for my phone and tablet) plus lamp and clock, to having all 4 things plugged directly in. Much cleaner and simpler (and safer), and all my electronics are happy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gardiner

customer_reviews.title: Very handy 120v/USB electrical outlet.
customer_reviews.text: I installed two of these in my home. One in the kitchen and one in one of our bathrooms. I like that I don't have the white or black boxes hanging off the outlets, especially in the kitchen. They charge my iPhone and/or my iPad in a timely manner. Often, I'll charge my iPhone while cooking dinner and by the time I finish cooking and eating, the phone is almost completely charged, if not 100% charged. The outlet boxes I installed these into are the deep design boxes I had installed when we remodeled. I don't have any experience putting these into the more shallow standard uotlet box.
customer_reviews.author: LD Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Outlet Upgrade for Today's Electronics
customer_reviews.text: My wife and son enjoy charging their phones at the same outlet without unplugging a coffee maker, etc. Bought 2 initially; purchased another 2 of these today. Do need a somewhat-deeper wall electrical box. Shallower than standard box will require a cover plate w/extension.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits in a standard single gang box - works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great USB outlet. It has those double terminals, so you can put this in the middle of a run without having to use pigtails. The ground is on the bottom. It is smaller than some other USB outlets that won't fit in a standard single gang box. This fits fine. I had no trouble at all installing this. It works great. I can charge my iphone and ipad with the dual usb and still have two regular AC outlets. This should be the new standard in home outlets. I will probably slowly start replacing many of the outlets in my home with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: I don't ever think you can go wrong with Leviton - Great product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this specific model to install over my workbench to keep my phone and vape charged. So far I am extremely pleased and don't expect that to change with my experiences in the past with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Waters

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year.
customer_reviews.text: After one year the USB ports don’t work and one of the outlets doesn’t work. This is installed in my kitchen island at home, not commercial but highly used for home use.
customer_reviews.author: D403j

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Works Great, but ... Snap power charger is better Pros: It charges the phones, and really makes use of an outlet without interferring with the main outlest. Cons: There a better product out there, that is easier to install called "Snap power charger", where the usb port is in the outlet's cover itself. So for those of you afraid of getting shocked while installing this plug, or don't want to take 15 minutes switch out an outlet, then get the "snap power charger" as there is less fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Dad Techy

customer_reviews.title: Good Outlet, Nit-Picky Issue
customer_reviews.text: First off, this a great outlet. It was very easy to install, and solidly built. If I had any quibble, it is that the face of the outlet is not flush with the surrounding faceplate, as other non-USB outlets tend to be. Granted, it's uniformly proud of the faceplate, but it still looks a bit odd.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D

customer_reviews.title: I really like having the USB ports
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid receptacle and it works on my wife's iPhone5, my Samsung S3, and my Asus Transformer TF101. That said, if you have an electrical device with anything larger than the smallest plug size, you're in trouble. I have this in my kitchen near the phone and the plug for that covers up part of the USB port. What a pain. I really like having the USB ports, but now I have to find some type of adapter (swivel adapter) or maybe try a short "extension cord" with flat rotating plug to free up the ports while having something plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Ytsejamer1

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: We had an electrician come out and install for us, so I can't speak to it's difficulty in being installed. The electrician had no problem with it and it fit into a standard sized outlet/box that was already there. You will want to get a face plate for it, the one that is recommended with it worked just find and fits snug around it. So far, two months later, no problems with it. We use it to charge with a variety of cords, as well as run our vacuum from the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: College Stealth

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year out of 3 outlets, only one ...
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year out of 3 outlets, only one outlet has one USB port on it that works. Beware they work for awhile but the usb chargers go out very quickly (first one to go out took about 1 month)
customer_reviews.author: oliver dreher

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm for charging multiple USB devices without having ...
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm for charging multiple USB devices without having a wall adapter. I prefer the minimalist look of theses and the face sits only a about 2mm off the wall. Also, it's nice not having to worry about some cheap knock-off adapter my girlfriend has burning down my house. I would suggest that if you plan to purchase this outlet that you choose the receptacle AND wallplate option if you choose any color other than white. This will ensure you have a matching colored wallplate that is also sized for the receptacle itself.
customer_reviews.author: Shane M.

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have with all of today’s electronics. It does a good job charging our cellphones, tablets and really anything with a usb charger. Plus it charges pretty fast. It is really convenient having them. I’ve installed them in a few areas of the house. They were easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: B.Brad

customer_reviews.title: Usb charger + outlet
customer_reviews.text: My 17 years old installed it and we really love the convenience. Will purchased some more to replace most of our outlets, the convenience is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Helene M. Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Good addition for any modern home
customer_reviews.text: Performs well and provides 2x regular outlets as well as 2 USB outputs capable of charging even high powered USB devices (like the typically challenging early generation ipads). The density of outlets on this wall plate is nice compared with the competition. On the downside the unit is very deep so need to ensure the wall box is deep enough to take the device and wiring behind it. Also I think it is a bit overpriced compared to the competitors, but then sometimes it is worth paying a premium to ensure long term quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hitmanray

customer_reviews.title: Nice way to free up plugs in my kitchen and still charge our phones!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but beware that the usb plugs will get in the way of most wall wart adapters so make sure you think about what other things you might want to plug in to this... It ended up working well for me as I was just looking for a way to add USB outlets in to an outlet on my kitchen counter. Now I have a cleaner look in my kitchen and freed up some outlets while still being able to charge our phones.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ OTHER ONE STAR REVIEWS!!!  Stops working!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a huge favor and read the other 1 star reviews!!! The USB ports on 2 of these outlets I purchased now do not work, this seems to be a common problem with these outlets, I’m not sure where to go now because I figured Leviton was a name brand, kinda weary about trying any others now due to this experience
customer_reviews.author: FireGoat

customer_reviews.title: Super convinient
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these types of outlets beside my couches, tables, kitchen counter, everywhere we typically plug in a USB device - and we have a lot of them. Prevents having to unplug a lamp to charge a device - which means the lamp isn't still unplugged the next time I go to use it in the dark. :)
customer_reviews.author: KWheel

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: very deep unit. hard to fit in a loaded single gang
customer_reviews.author: Helios21

customer_reviews.title: Love the plug configuration
customer_reviews.text: This outlet replaced a regular outlet in our kitchen. Love the plug configuration. We have two appliances plugged in and can charge our two phones all at the same time. And the wiring in the back of the outlet allows daisy chaining if this outlet isn't the last one in the circuit. The outlet is fatter than a regular one because of the USB charging circuitry but it fits within standard receptacles.
customer_reviews.author: William Davison

customer_reviews.title: USB Ports Died In One Month
customer_reviews.text: The USB charging ports stopped working in about a month. Definitely would NOT buy this. For the price, you can get a LOT of plug in adapters!!
customer_reviews.author: Portsmith

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, USB charging ports slow
customer_reviews.text: USB ports will not charge an iPad or iPhone as fast as a traditional charger will. On a side note, construction seems to be quality and looks very nice after install.
customer_reviews.author: Huffy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and fit the box perfectly. I never worked on electrical stuff around the house before but this was a piece of cake. I turned the power off to the area that I was working on. Tested the outlet to make sure it was safe prior to removing the old and installing the new. A needle nose pliers were need to bend the wire around the screw. Got it done and works perfectly with my HTC One and my wife's Galaxy S4. Also charges the kindle HDX and Google Nexus 7.
customer_reviews.author: GMK

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!! Great brand!!!
customer_reviews.text: Took about 15 minutes to install, would have taken less time but I lost one screw for the cover plate. Oh and this model doesn't come with a new cover plate so don't break yours off like I did. I plugged in the IPhone, IPad, and charged my video camera using the standard outlet and they all fit. A little pricey for the convenience of what it is used for but I am sure in time they will go down in price. Don't waste your money on the off brands. S@m's Club as a GE product right now, buy 2 for $30. Also a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Its HUGE but it woks good
customer_reviews.text: It is so big, it wont fit in all electrical boxes. I had to put it in a wall box that I really didnt want to put it in, but its functionality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Tired of those ugly Amazon Dot and Echo transformers clogging ...
customer_reviews.text: Tired of those ugly Amazon Dot and Echo transformers clogging up your plugs? Get this outlet! It contains two, high-powered, USB ports and well as the traditional two outlets ... just plug your Dot cord into the USB ports and free up your outlets and it looks so much nicer. Amazon is one of the few places where you can get this in colors other than white at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. I replaced an outlet in my kitchen with this easily and now i have USB charges for phones built in. I bought cables in white on Amazon and leave them plugged in on my counter. Now when anyone needs a charge, it is ready to go. Plus I can still plug in other things to the outlet. I got one for my parents and I will be buying more of these. Installs just like a regular outlet with no issues. Slightly larger than a regular outlet, but not really more than a regular GFI outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Pleased or Not

customer_reviews.title: The USB ports are terrible on this
customer_reviews.text: The USB ports are terrible on this. I can plug my phone in overnight and it wont be fully charged 8 hours later. If I use either of the plugs though it has no issue charging at all. I am very unsatisfied with this product, if I would have known that this was so poor at charging that I would not end up using the USB ports I could have saved the money and just bought a cheap outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Classy K

customer_reviews.title: USB port dead in less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The USB ports stopped working in less than 2 years, conveniently after the warranty period is over. These Leviton products are not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Micha Sunarjadi

customer_reviews.title: How I survived without it?
customer_reviews.text: Installed 2 of these in the house. Love it The only problem I had was the cover plate. I did not realize that it requires different type (I had standard one). HD had one for like $0.97. Have to push a little harder to plug in something in regular outlet due to temper resistant feature (must have with toddler in the house). Probably will install couple more in strategic places of the house.
customer_reviews.author: SerhiyI

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great, handy receptacle. A little deeper than a standard duplex receptacle, but not so deep as to cause issues fitting in a single-gang box. Have been using them behind the bedroom night stands to charge phones at night and they work great with all devices we have - iPad Mini, iPhone 5, and Blackberry Q10. (I recommend the 6-foot Anker lightning cable for Apple devices so you have plenty of slack to pick up the phone without leaning over the edge of the bed!) Don't forget to buy a decorator/decora-style wall plate if you are replacing a standard receptacle.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D.

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have USB plugs in brown
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a plug for the kitchen island that matched the wood and would not stand out. This plus was a close enough match and the USB plugs are very handy. I was glad to find something that met our needs and in a brown shade without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Vdub

customer_reviews.title: So nice to have USB charging around the house
customer_reviews.text: I especially love these in the kitchen. I don't have to tromp around the house looking for who moved the charger, it's always built into the wall so the family tends to leave the cables there as well so I can always find a charge when needed.
customer_reviews.author: LOTRouter

customer_reviews.title: This device is top notch. My first experience with ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is top notch. My first experience with it was on a job that this was specified on for a couple of rooms in the house. First, it DOES NOT transmit data I was impressed how quickly it would charge my cell phone and notebook. It will retrofit into any grounded duplex outlet box. It has a "chip" to determine the optimal speed to charge the devices through the USB outlet It unclutters the bricks plugged in all over the house. in my opinion the USB cable is less unsightly cons: it ain't cheap
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than home depot USB added convenience
customer_reviews.text: Its 3 dollars cheaper here than at home depot. It is entirely made of plastic and is much bigger (deeper) than a traditional outlet. It works as described and I recommend this product. But the depth of the outlet may complicate installation. You may have to fight to stuff the wires into the box to accomodate the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a nice upgrade for kitchen counter outlets
customer_reviews.text: it works nicely for kitchen counter outlets. the coffee maker power plug, Canon camera battery charger, and two USB-A charging cables (Anker Lightning USB-A cables) fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but great product from Leviton as usual
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing outlets! I ahve ordered a bunch to place all over my house especially next to night stands so I don't have to deal with USB adapters for power, I can plug my USB cables directly into these to charges my devices. These have worked great for iPhones, Android Phones, Windows Phones, iPads, Kindles, and other USB charge capable electronics. I have both of the USB ports occupied, and can still plug in standard 2 and 3 prong outlet devices in without an issue. While a little pricey, I don't have to worry about finding USB charging adapters anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hendricks

product_meta.title: Leviton T5632-W USB Charger/Tamper-Resistant Duplex Receptacle, 15-Amp, White,1-Pack
product_meta.description: Size Name:1 Pack| Color Name:White15 Ampere, 125 Volt, Decora Tamper-Resistant Outlet. NEMA 5-15R, 18W (3.6 Ampere), 5VDC, Dual Type A USB Chargers. Grounding, Side Wired & Back Wired.
feature_bullets: SMART - Built-in smart chip recognizes the individual device’s charging requirement to optimize the charge
POWERFUL – Two high-powered charging ports with 3.6A of charging power
CONVENIENT – No more searching for charging adapters! Upgrade your existing outlets so you can charge up to two USB powered electronics at once, leaving the outlets free for additional power needs
ENHANCED SAFETY – Built in overcurrent protection helps protect the electronic from receiving too much power which can damage the device
EASY - Compact design fits in a standard wallbox and works with Decora and Decora Plus screwless wallplates, back and side wired for easy installation
Highest power device on the market
